speaker: LO-FAT
line: Going to kill! Going to kill!

speaker: RETRO
line: Just stay out of my way, Geeks. I'm going to the next level today. I'm a death machine.

speaker: COMPUTERIZED VOICE
line: Status: Combat ready. Situation: Guerrilla units in immediate vicinity of insertion module.

speaker: GEEKS
line: Woo-hoo! Woo! Let's do this! Bring it on!!

speaker: PHOEBE
line: If I don't let these boys out they're going to kill each other.

speaker: RETRO
line: They're out there, Geeks. Looking to fry your huevos.

speaker: IVAN
line: Whoa! It's a total massacre out there.

speaker: [CLOSED CAPTIONING
line: We know you're up there! Prepare to die! ]

speaker: GEEKS
line: Go! Move out, baby! Come on, baby!

speaker: MAITREYA
line: I am Maitreya. This is my game.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agents Mulder and Scully, FBI. We're expected.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: I need to scan your ID.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: I'll need you to look over those nondisclosure agreements.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "To protect all proprietary or intellectual property owned by F.P.S., a private California corporation under the harshest penalty of law."

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can get in the Pentagon easier than this.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Dudes! Agent Mulder, what's up, wild man? Welcome to the land where silicon meets silicone.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Can I get you a latte from the bar or perhaps a bottle of designer H20?

speaker: SCULLY
line: How about a simple explanation as to why we're here?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Well, why don't we take a brief moment just to feel the pulse of the new American gold rush?

speaker: BYERS
line: You're standing on the launch pad of a rocket headed for the stars.

speaker: BYERS
line: Langly did some programming for them. He created all of the bad guys.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: We don't want to give you the idea that we're major profit participants.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Options... preferred rate. Vesting immediately with a short-term exercise against venture collateral to bypass S.E.C. regs.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Game ships on Friday. 50 malls across the United States and Japan.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Only there's a dead body between you and untold riches.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know about you guys but I'd be checking my shorts for cake.

speaker: IVAN
line: No! See, when somebody is shot, there's a gun involved, right? That is absolutely impossible because there's no way anybody could ever get a gun past security.

speaker: IVAN
line: It's a laser blaster. For wasting cybertrash.

speaker: IVAN
line: The weapons feed off the F.P.S. mainframe. The effect is intensely real, but harmless.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You say this weapon is a toy but this man clearly has gunshot wounds through his...

speaker: IVAN
line: Stun suit. See, it's rigged with paint for wounds and kill shots. It's total bleeding-edge technology.

speaker: IVAN
line: Against the game. You waste the cyberthugs before they waste you. It's all about body count. But they're computer-generated images running on a projector. It all happens in the game space.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: It's a total digital environment. Nothing's real. It's all virtual.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: I was in the control booth with Ivan. Retro was in the zone. His telemetry was solid. He looked unstoppable; like he was on his way to the next level when suddenly, he was cooked meat.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the next call's going to be to the local P.D.

speaker: IVAN
line: No cops! No cops. You said no cops. You said you had connections.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, connections or not, you've got a murder victim here.

speaker: IVAN
line: Headlines-- just what the Wall Street money dudes want to read as we're going to market.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, this is Special Agent Dana Scully with the FBI...

speaker: MULDER
line: You said you were in the control booth when it happened? Can you tell me exactly what you saw?

speaker: PHOEBE
line: I'm still not sure if we even saw it. I mean, one minute everything is going perfect and then we crashed. Ivan and I were sitting here. We both just looked at each other. It happened so fast. Moxie's covering Retro who's going inside after the enemy to rack up beaucoup points.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: And then, goosh! Retro's vitals spike like he's been shot.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: And they're right back in the game space.

speaker: LANGLY
line: We don't know. There's no rez images on interior game spaces.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: Maybe I can. I'll strip down to wireframe display.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: I mean... We've never mapped this area before. Retro was in noncombat space.

speaker: MULDER
line: That ain't all she's packing. Can you print that out for me?

speaker: DETECTIVE LACOEUR
line: Let me get this straight, Agent Scully: You've got no murder weapon, no forensic evidence, no motive, no suspect.

speaker: SCULLY
line: My partner, Agent Mulder. This is Detective LaCoeur.

speaker: DETECTIVE LACOEUR
line: Hey, I'll put out an A.P.B.-- for Frederick's of Hollywood.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that's any voluptuous vixen out of any number of video games.

speaker: MULDER
line: But she's not in any video game, she's in this one and no one programmed her in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, but even if they had, she's not real. She's a character. She's some immature hormonal fantasy.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Daryl Musashi. You see who that is? Daryl Musashi.

speaker: BYERS
line: Word is he slums as a game designer when he's not contracted to the CIA. The boy wonder of virtual mayhem.

speaker: BYERS
line: Ivan must have called him to go in and slay the ninja babe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, why does this game have the effect of reducing grown men back to moony adolescence?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you want me to autopsy the body?

speaker: COMPUTERIZED VOICE
line: Immersion module in descent mode. T-minus 20 seconds to engagement.

speaker: IVAN
line: Pay attention, worms. Daryl Musashi's going to show us how this game's supposed to be played.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: I heard he scored 90 consecutive wins on Demon Space Drifter.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Look at him. The man's a sphinx.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hey, Byers, you got to see this. Mulder, get over here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that him? Is that Daryl Musashi?

speaker: LANGLY
line: He just stepped into the game.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why is he just standing there?

speaker: MULDER
line: He hasn't even broken a sweat.

speaker: IVAN
line: Look at him! He's not even waiting for the reset. He's going right for the kill.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Preliminary external examination of deceased, a twenty-ish male, name listed only as "Retro," offers no additional clues as to actual cause of death.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scratch that. Cause of death is from a large entry wound at the sternum, resulting in trauma to the internal organs and blood loss. Wound is consistent with a high-velocity impact from a large projectile which passed through a three-ply Kevlar jacket. Scratch that. Wound is result of high-velocity impact from an unknown object, which even if it did enter the body left no damn trace evidence whatsoever-- no powder burns, no chemical signatures of any kind of explosive propellant...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought I was on to something. You know, Mulder, this suit holds more than just exploding paint cells. It measures the player's vital signs from the heart rate to the extant body chemistry and then sends that information back to the computer. Then when a player is shot a battery pack sends a 12-volt jolt that keeps him from getting up until the game is over.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, well, if only that were the case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought at first that maybe the uh, suit had malfunctioned, that one of the charges had blown inward but, unfortunately, that wasn't the case either.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've got a birthday coming up. You have to admit, though, Scully, this is a pretty amazing piece of technology.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, wasted on a stupid game.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dressing up like high-tech warriors to play a futuristic version of Cowboys and Indians? What kind of moron gets his ya-yas out like that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what - what purpose does this game serve except to add to a culture of violence in a country that's already out of control?

speaker: MULDER
line: Who says it adds to it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think that taking up weapons and creating gratuitous virtual mayhem has any redeeming value whatsoever? I mean, that the testosterone frenzy that it creates stops when the game does?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that's rather sexist, isn't it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I mean, maybe the game provides an outlet for certain impulses, that it fills a void in our genetic makeup that the more civilizing effects of society failed to provide for.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that must be why men feel the great need to blast the crap out of stuff.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, testosterone frenzy or no the only suspect we have in this man's murder is a woman.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I've seen it. A computer-animated woman, Mulder, with a computer-animated weapon.

speaker: MULDER
line: A flintlock pistol-- which would leave a very large entry wound.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Pictures don't kill people, Mulder, guns kill people.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.... You're kidding. Thanks. L.A. Sheriff's department just picked up a female suspect for the murders.

speaker: OFFICERS
line: Who's the man? Who's the man? You're the man. You're the man with the badge.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You get the feeling these men have something better to do?

speaker: DETECTIVE LACOEUR
line: We picked her up outside of a strip club in Reseda. Fits your description to a tee.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For the record, can you state your name, please?

speaker: JADE BLUE AFTERGLOW
line: For the record again, my name is Jade Blue Afterglow. I reside...

speaker: JADE BLUE AFTERGLOW
line: That is my real name. What were you expecting? Mildred?

speaker: JADE BLUE AFTERGLOW
line: I sure seem to be upsetting a lot of people around here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you're not upsetting me, Miss, uh...

speaker: JADE BLUE AFTERGLOW
line: I sure upset the man running the metal detector.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You say that you have no knowledge of Ivan Martinez or a company known as First Person Shooter or F.P.S.?

speaker: JADE BLUE AFTERGLOW
line: I meet a lot of men.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would it surprise you to know that you have been placed at a crime scene in the offices of F.P.S.?

speaker: JADE BLUE AFTERGLOW
line: Let's just say it takes a whole lot to surprise me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You might want to start telling the truth.

speaker: JADE BLUE AFTERGLOW
line: And what truth am I not telling you?

speaker: MULDER
line: That you murdered two men. One with a 14th century broadsword and the other with a flintlock pistol.

speaker: JADE BLUE AFTERGLOW
line: Oh. You must have had me confused with my sister-- Xena, Warrior Princess.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you denying that this is you?

speaker: JADE BLUE AFTERGLOW
line: The medical imaging place in Culver City. I got paid to let them do this body-scan thing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They paid you to scan your body?

speaker: JADE BLUE AFTERGLOW
line: You think that's the strangest thing I've been paid to do?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're very sorry, Miss Afterglow but, um... We're sorry. You're... You're free to go.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know about you, Scully, but I am feeling the great need to blast the crap out of something.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: Oh. I must've fell asleep. I... I was just going to take a nap. I've been up for 70 hours straight, analyzing code, trying to fix the game.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: Um, he's with the money guys. They're all freaking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we need to talk to him right away about a woman named Jade Blue Afterglow. He scanned her body and he created a character out of her. He put her in the game.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Lone Gunmen are on the floor.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: Yeah, Langly and I wrote a software patch. We're going to run a rez-up test on the game.

speaker: LONE GUNMEN
line: Hey! What's going on?! Phoebe, are you paying attention? We're not ready yet! Who's running the program? What the hell's going on? Phoebe? Come on.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: I don't believe this. The program's running itself. This can't be happening.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: This was supposed to be background only. There wasn't supposed to be any gameplay.

speaker: BYERS
line: I'm okay. It's a flesh wound.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: It's her. She's out there. She nailed Byers with that flintlock.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, on the count of three I'm going to lay down some cover for us. Ready? One... Two... Three.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I said, where's Mulder? Maybe you guys didn't hear me. Come on, guys. Where is he?

speaker: LANGLY
line: We don't know. He just took off after her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I saw what he did. But where did he go?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I saw where he went. I want to know where he is. Is there a door? Or an exit? Or some kind of passageway that he could have used?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Just the one you came in.

speaker: BYERS
line: It's impossible. It's a digital environment. It's just a game.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Easy for you to say.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: This monitors everyone playing the game. There-- player four. It's his telemetry.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Making a kill switch so we can shut down the game.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: Don't touch that. It won't work. There's no way to do that.

speaker: IVAN
line: We are back in business. Baby... You are dope.

speaker: IVAN
line: We were toast. I felt the flames licking my ass. Then the bankers

speaker: SAW THE LETTERS ON THE AUTOPSY
line: F-B-I. CAUSE OF DEATH: Unknown. You fixed our problems. The game's going to ship and we're going to be counting Franklins.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, and you're going to be counting teeth.

speaker: BYERS
line: Her partner's lost in the game.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jade Blue Afterglow-- does that ring a bell?

speaker: PHOEBE
line: I don't know how it happened.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You knew about her? Then it was you. You scanned that woman's body.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: Into my computer. She was my creation. She was mine.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: You don't know what it's like-- day in and day out choking in a haze of rampant testosterone.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: I mean, she was all I had to keep me sane. My only way to strike back as a woman. She was my goddess. Everything I can never be.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But, Phoebe, she is still a killer. I can't explain it, but she is. And you put her in that game.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: No, I didn't. I was creating my own game in my own computer. It was totally secret. I never told anyone. But somehow she jumped programs and she's feeding off the male aggression. It's making her stronger and stronger. I need your help. You're the only one who can understand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've got to destroy her, Phoebe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there's got to be some way. There's got to be some vulnerability or a weakness somewhere.

speaker: MULDER
line: I bet you think you're going to kick my butt up and down the block.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's input herself into the game. We have to download her.

speaker: BYERS
line: We can't even get on-line. The system's been hijacked.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Frohike, what's wrong? What is that?

speaker: IVAN
line: This is your fault. You put her here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey. No fair picking on a girl.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: No. We're just in rez up.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: Yes, it is. It's level two.

speaker: IVAN
line: No, no, no, no. I can't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look! We have to get him out of there!

speaker: MULDER
line: That's not really fair, is it?

speaker: PHOEBE
line: This is level two. It only gets harder.

speaker: IVAN
line: No one's ever beaten level two.

speaker: LANGLY
line: How do you kill something that won't die?

speaker: IVAN
line: My whole life is in this game.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What are you trying to do?

speaker: PHOEBE
line: It's the only way to save them.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Let it go! Both of you!

speaker: IVAN
line: She was trying to save her creation; her Goddess.

speaker: PHOEBE
line: Well, you don't care who dies as long as your game survives.

speaker: LANGLY
line: And we're not going to let them die.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Give me that! This is out of your hands now.

speaker: BYERS
line: We have to shut down the program.

speaker: LANGLY
line: You're the only ones that can do it.

speaker: IVAN
line: Don't do it, Phoebe. I'm so close.

speaker: LANGLY
line: We've killed the game and Mulder and Scully along with it.

speaker: MULDER
line: We came, we saw, we conquered. And if the taste of victory is sweet, the taste of virtual victory is not Sweet 'N Low, nor the bullets made of sugar. Maybe out past where the imagination ends our true natures lie, waiting to be confronted on their own terms. Out where the intellect is at war with the primitive brain in the hostile territory of the digital world where laws are silent and rules disappear in the midst of arms. Born in anarchy with an unquenchable bloodthirst we shudder to think what might rise up from the darkness.
